member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportFolder.GetRelativePath(System.String[],System.String)
member.summary:
Given two paths that coincide for their common length, where one path, deepPath, is longer than the other, return the tokenized path of deepPath that is the path �past� shallowPath
Or in other words return a tokenized path that is relative to shallowPath
member.param: the shorter path to return the relative path from
the longer path that extends past shallowPath
member.returns: the tokenized relative path from shallowPath, null if these paths don't coinicide

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingOperations
member.summary: Contains the field names and corresponding values for operations that users can perform on items in SQL Server Reporting Services.
member.remarks: This class maps to the Microsoft.ReportingServices.Interfaces.OperationNames class in the Reporting Services SDK. See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.reportingservices.interfaces.operationnames_members(SQL.90).aspx for more info.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingTaskPermissions
member.summary: Lists the permissions associated with item-level and system-level tasks.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingTasks
member.summary: Provides a list of role tasks available in Report Server, as well as the list of tasks associated with default roles.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUploader
member.summary: A helper class for uploading reports and other reports items to a Report Server instance. The uploader is driven by an XML manifest and a source folder containing RDL files.

member.name: E:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUploader.MessageLogged
member.summary: An event that is fired whenever an event is logged by the uploader.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUploader.#ctor(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingService,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUploaderData)
member.summary: Creates a new instance.
member.param: A report server proxy.
The configuration data for the uploader.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUploader.Validate
member.summary: Ensures that the current input configuration data is valid and usable (e.g. validating that report files exist, and that the user has permissions to items in RS).

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUploader.Validate(System.Xml.XmlNode,System.String)
member.summary: Validates the xml for the reports is valid (e.g. validating that report files exist).

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUploader.UploadReportsFromTemplateFolder(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUploaderProjectData,System.String,System.Boolean,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUploaderMessageHandler)
member.summary: Open ProcessTemplate.xml and get all reporting related tasks and upload reports

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUploader.LoadReportingTasks(System.String,System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary: Get reporting task xml nodes from ProcessTemplate.xml
member.remarks: This is simplified version of src\VSIntegration\Client\PCW\Package\PCW\MethodologyLoader.cs It only handles reporting tasks and assumes that the tasks in the xml are in the order to be processed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUploader.DownloadUnzippedTemplate(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.TfsTeamProjectCollection,System.String,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUploaderMessageHandler)
member.summary: download template zip file and extract it to a temporary folder
member.remark: This is similar to TemplateManagementServices.DownLoadAndExtractTemplate() in VSIntegration.Client module.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUploader.ValidateProjectFolder
member.remarks: This is copied from src\VsIntegration\Client\PCW\Package\PCW\RosettaReportUploader.cs and following changes were made: - push code to ReportingUtilities.ItemExistsInFolder

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUploader.Run
member.summary: Executes the upload process by parsing all the elements in the input manifest XML and performing the requested operations.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUploaderData
member.summary: Encapsulates the configuration data used as input to the report uploader. This consists of: - An XML manifest containing upload operations. - A source folder containing RDL files. - A target report folder that already exists in Report Server, or Project Data that will be used to create a reporting site.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUploaderData.AllowTargetFolderToExist
member.summary: This means that we need to be tolerant of the target site (project root folder) existing already.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUploaderData.ForceUpdate
member.summary: This means that we need to create folders and reports in the manifest regardless of whether they already exist or not. Folders may already exist, but should be created if they don't exist. Reports or datasources may already exist and if they do, they will be overwritten.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUploaderProjectData
member.summary: Encapsulates the information used by the uploader to create a reporting site for a given team project.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUploaderException
member.summary: An exception class that indicates an error condition during report upload.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUploaderMessageHandler
member.summary: A handler that gets notified whenever the report uploader loads the ocurrence of an event.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.CreateReportingServiceProxy(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.TfsConnection,System.Uri)
member.summary: Creates the reporting service proxy with the credentials from a given TFS instance, and the service URL from a given reporting server entry for the current zone.

The reporting server entry.

member.param: The users credentials.
The location for the reportserver service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.CreateReportingServiceProxy(System.Uri,System.Net.ICredentials)
member.summary: Creates the reporting service proxy for a given service URL with a set of provided credentials.

The credentials to use when accessing the web service.

member.summary: Returns 'true' if reporting is configured for the specified project, false otherwise

member.summary: For Excel Reporting: Checks whether reporting Cube is configured with the given TFS server Two cases which can affect reporting cube configuration 1. A full server license but reporting cube not configured 2. A TFSe server license where reporting cube is not available
member.returns: true if reporting cube is configured

member.summary: Retrieves the Report manager uri.

member.summary: Strip off known service names, like 'ReportService.asmx' and 'ReportService2005.asmx'.

member.summary: Formats the path for accessing a particular report for a particular item path. This is primarily used by TfsRedirect.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.GetUniqueItemPath(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingService,System.String)
member.summary: Generates a unique report item path given a base name. If no item exists with the base path, that is returned. Otherwise, a numeric postfix is appended until the path becomes unique and non-existent.
member.param: The reporting service proxy.
The base path to use.
member.returns: A unique report item path guaranteed to not exist.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.ItemExists(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingService,System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether a given report item exists (can be of any item type).
member.param: The web service proxy.
The path to an item.
member.returns: true if a report item with that given path exists; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.FolderExists(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingService,System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether a given report folder exists.

The folder path.
member.returns: true if the folder exists; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.CreateFolder(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingService,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a report folder given a full folder path. This will attempt to create any elements in the path that are missing.
member.param: The web service proxy.
full The folder path (starting with /).

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.EnsureFolderExists(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingService,System.String)
member.summary: Ensures the specified folder exists creating it if it does not
member.param: The web service proxy.
full The folder path (starting with /).

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.BatchCreateFolders(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingService,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Creates a set of report folders in a single batch operation. Note that the parents of the input folders must already exist, or the folders must be passed int the appropriate order if creating a hierarchy.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.BatchEnsureFoldersExist(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingService,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Ensures that a set of report folders exist in a single batch operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.IsInRole(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingService,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines wheter a given user plays a given role for a given item path.
member.param: The web service proxy.
The path to a report item.
The user being checked.
The name of the role to verify.
member.returns: true if the user is in that role; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.AddRolePolicy(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingService,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a role policy for a given user and item path (if the policy didn't already exist).
member.param: The web service proxy.
The path to a report item.
The user being checked.
The name of the role to verify.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.RemoveRolePolicy(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingService,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a role policy for a given user and item path (if the policy didn't already exist).
member.param: The web service proxy.
The path to a report item.
The user being checked.
The name of the role to verify.
member.returns: whether the user had the role (and therefore, whether it was removed)

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.EnsureRoleExists(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingService,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Ensures that a given Reporting Services role exists and has the associated required tasks.
member.param: A web service proxy.
The target role name.
The role description used if creating the role.
The collection of task ids that we require the role to have.
member.returns: true if a role was created or an existing role was updated; false if the role already existed and didn't need to be udpated.
member.remarks: If the role doesn't exist, it will be created with the associated tasks. If it already exists, and doesn't have one of the required tasks, it will be updated. If it exists and has all required tasks, nothing will be changed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.EnsureRoleHasTasks(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingService,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Ensures that an existing role has the associated required tasks.
member.param: A web service proxy.
The target role name.
The collection of task ids that we require the role to have.
member.returns: true if a role was created or an existing role was updated; false if the role already existed and didn't need to be udpated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.CreateRole(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingService,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Creates a role with a set of associated tasks.
member.param: A web service proxy.
The target role name.
The role description.
The collection of task ids that will be associated with the role.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.RoleExists(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingService,System.String)
member.summary: Determines if a given role exists.
member.param: A web service proxy.
The target role name.
member.returns: true if the role exists; otherwise, false

member.summary: Changes the description of a role.
member.param: A web service proxy.
The target role name.
The new description of the role.

The folder path.

member.param: The web service proxy.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.ValidateItemPath(System.String)
member.summary: Validates an input item path: It cannot be null or empty Exceed a maximum length of 260 characters It has to start with "/" Contain items with invalid names Contain any surrogate character

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.IsValidItemName(System.String)
member.summary: Checks that a given report item name is valid. It cannot be null or empty, cannot contain invalid characters, and cannot consists of only dots or spaces.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.CheckContainsInvalidPathChars(System.String)
member.summary: Throws an exception if the path contains invalid characters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.ContainsInvalidPathChars(System.String)
member.summary: Helper method to test if a path contains invalid chars
member.param: the path to be validated (null or empty is ok; means relative to self)
member.returns: true if does not contain invalid path chars, false if it does

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.EndOfPath(System.String)
member.summary: Get the last file or folder name in a path
member.param: a path
member.returns: Empty if the path was to root or empty, otherwise return the end of the path

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.GetParent(System.String)
member.summary: Get the parent of the current report node in the path

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.GetExistingSelfOrAncestor(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingService,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the path to the given report item, or its closest ancestor folder if the report item doesn't exit.
member.param: The web service proxy.
A report item path.
member.returns: The report item path if it exists, or its closest ancestor folder if the report item doesn't exist.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.CombinePath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Combines a base report item path with a sub item.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.TryGetReportingServicesErrorMessage(System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException)
member.summary: Attempts to extract the exact Report Server error message from the SoapException Detail XML Element, if available. This provides a cleaner error message for the end user, removing exception names and stack traces from the SoapException message.
member.param: A SoapException that results from invoking the Report Server.
member.returns: The error message corresponding to the failed RS operation, if available.
member.remarks:
For instance, a full SoapException message might be:
System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException: "The path of the item '/@$' is not valid. The full path must be less than 260 characters long; other restrictions apply. If the report server is in native mode, the path must start with slash." ---> Microsoft.ReportingServices.Diagnostics.Utilities.InvalidItemPathException: The path of the item '/@$' is not valid. The full path must be less than 260 characters long; other restrictions apply. If the report server is in native mode, the path must start with slash. at Microsoft.ReportingServices.WebServer.ReportingService2005Impl.GetItemType(String Item, ItemTypeEnum& Type) at Microsoft.ReportingServices.WebServer.ReportingService2005.GetItemType(String Item, ItemTypeEnum& Type)
but we only want to extract the part in "quotes" to surface it to the end user.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.ConvertException(System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException)
member.summary: Converts a SoapException to a typed ReportingServiceException, potentially cleaning up the returned error message.
member.param: The SoapException returned by a ReportingService call.
member.returns: A new exception that wraps the original one.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportingUtilities.CatalogItemComparer
member.summary: Private inner class CatalogItemComparer, used to compare two CatalogItems by path

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.Reporting.ReportData
member.summary: Data structure to define the report with parameters and associated data sources.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.SharePoint.ProcessGuidanceHelper
member.summary: Helper class to aid in launching Process Guidance and finding urls associated with process guidance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.SharePoint.ProcessGuidanceHelper.LaunchProcessGuidance(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.TfsTeamProjectCollection,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary:
Launches process guidance for the specified tpc and team project. Iterates over the specified set of document paths, finds the first valid file (one that exists), and launches the url.
If process guidance is not configured it will launch the 'not configured' url. If process guidance is configured but it cannot reach any document in the set of paths, it will attempt to open the process guidance site directly (just the path, no file appended).

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.SharePoint.ProcessGuidanceHelper.GetProcessGuidanceUrl(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.TfsTeamProjectCollection,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the process guidance url after checking that it exists. First tries ProcessGuidance.aspx then ProcessGuidance.html. If process guidance is not configured it will return the 'not configured' url. If process guidance is configured but it cannot reach either of the files, it will return the root process guidance path.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.SharePoint.ProcessGuidanceHelper.IsProcessGuidanceConfigured(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.TfsTeamProjectCollection,System.String)
member.summary: Returns 'true' if process guidance is configured for the specified project, 'false' otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.SharePoint.ProcessGuidanceHelper.IsValidUrl(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.TfsTeamProjectCollection,System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether or not the specified url points to a file that exists.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.SharePoint.ProcessGuidanceHelper.GetProcessGuidanceUrl(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.TfsTeamProjectCollection,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Gets a uri for a process guidance path by iterating over the specified set of document paths and checking to see if they exist. Returns the uri for the first document it finds that exists. If none exist it will return the root process guidance site. If process guidance is not configured it will return the 'not configured' url.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.SharePoint.Lists
member.summary: Non-generated implementation for the WSS Lists service proxy.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.SharePoint.SharePointTeamFoundationIntegrationService
member.summary: Non-generated implementation for the proxy of the TFS service on WSS servers. This is called TeamFoundationIntegrationService on the SharePoint side, but we added the SharePoint Prefix to make is more clear since TFS also has an Integration service.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.SharePoint.WssWebTemplates
member.summary: Enumerates some of the default template definitions for WSS sites.
member.remarks: From: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/administration.admin.createsite.aspx Can be obtained doing: stsadm -o -enuminstalledsitetemplates -url "http://intranet/".

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.SharePoint.WssTreeNode
member.summary: Represents a node in a tree of items returned by the WSS server.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.SharePoint.WssFileUploadException
member.summary: Exception class that captures errors during a WSS file upload action. This is thrown whenever WSS returns an error after a file upload operation. The error elements include the local file name that we are trying to upload, the error message itself and inner exception containing details.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.SharePoint.WssDataUploadException
member.summary: Exception class for WSS Data Upload. This is thrown whenever WSS returns an error during the file upload process. Error elements include remote file, site url, WSS error text, and WSS error number extracted from the text.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.SharePoint.DocumentLibraryInfo.AsciiName
member.summary: Name of the document library as it appears in the url (not necessarily the same as the Title).

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.SharePoint.DocumentLibraryInfo.IsValid
member.summary: Determines whether or not we were able to get the appropriate set of information about the document library from the information that SharePoint sent back.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.SharePoint.DocumentLibraryInfo.IsHidden
member.summary: Determines whether or not a document library is hidden.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.SharePoint.DocumentLibraryInfo.CheckoutRequired
member.summary: Determines whether or not the document library requires checkout to edit files. If so, then adding a new file will cause it to be automatically checked out to the current user and not visible to other users of the system.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.SharePoint.DocumentLibraryInfo.TryGetBooleanAttribute(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.String,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Attempts to retrieve the boolean value of an attribute on the specified node.
member.returns: true if successful, false otherwise

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.SharePoint.DocumentLibraryInfo.TryGetAsciiName(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.TfsConnection,System.Xml.XmlElement,System.String@)
member.summary: Extracts the relevant URLs from the document library xml node and attempts to determine the url path segment for the document library (historically known as the 'ascii' name for the document library). This uses up to 3 different mechanisms to extract the ascii name, if they all fail then the document library is considered invalid.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.SharePoint.DocumentLibraryInfo.TryGetAsciiNameFromWebFullUrl(System.String,System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Attempts to extract the 'Ascii' name of the document library by trimming off the web url from the view url and returing the first segment of the path. This mechanism works on WSS 3.0+ machines only, WSS 2.0 does not have the 'WebFullUrl' attribute.
member.param: Url of the default view for the document library.
Url of the web, should be the prefix of the defaultViewUrl

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.SharePoint.DocumentLibraryInfo.TryGetAsciiNameFromIRegistrationDelta(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.TfsConnection,System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Attempts to retrieve the 'ascii' name by diffing the default view url with the data in IRegistration and removing the prefix. This should only be necessary when working against Orcas servers using sub-sites (an extremely rare and unsupported case). This was added in Orcas SP1.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Client.SharePoint.DocumentLibraryInfo.TryGetAsciiNameFromTemplateUrl(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Split the default view url and take the segment that *should* be the document library name on Orcas servers. This is the mechanism that was used in Orcas and Whidbey and is used only as a last resort on those platforms.

members.member: Returns a localized string given a resource string name.
Returns a localized integer given a resource string name.
Returns a localized string given a resource string name.

A little helper function to alleviate some typing associated with loading resources and formatting the strings. In DEBUG builds, it also asserts that the number of format arguments and the length of args match.
